taskDescription: If methanol rather than water is added at the end of a Hell–Volhard–Zelinskii reaction, an ester rather than an acid is produced. Show how you would carry out the following transformation, and propose a mechanism for the ester-forming step.
detailedSolution: The intermediate α-bromo acid bromide undergoes a nucleophilic acyl substitution reaction with methanol to give an α-bromo ester.
